overview: From 2025-12-07 to 2025-12-14, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 59 new PRs (37 merged), 13 new issues, and 63 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Update op-node v1.16.3. EL node can’t synchronize
topIssues.author: J1a-wei
topIssues.body:
We run Optimism, Base, and Worldchain using op-geth and op-node. Today we upgraded op-node from v1.16.2 to v1.16.3, and now all three op-stack deployments can’t synchronize—the logs all show the same issue. 

```
2025-12-05T15:53:59.448752163+08:00 t=2025-12-05T07:53:59+0000 lvl=info msg="Walking back L1Block by hash" curr=0x1778fbe67edaff50fd66937a1bc84001a30675fbb49b2f9d1715534c34c684f9:23941450 next=0xc67cfd13b7484bc173f3deb0d85f9d64c0d7a1ebeaca1163572c60b43c313e66:23941449 l2block=0xace3b44d8317456b0220f81608117215ee74152a05bdfce00c64fdecd235f5c1:144637148

```

topIssues.title: Run precompile FP tests on Jovian fork
topIssues.author: Inphi

topIssues.title: [oncall] Enable log retention on CloudFlare
topIssues.author: janjakubnanista
topIssues.body:
**Description**

Currently we don't store logs from CloudFlare at all which makes investigation of networking & security issues very difficult.

To mitigate this, the easiest way is to enable log explorer, a pay-per-GB-stored CloudFlare add-on.

topIssues.title: op-batcher: ensure full shutdown when "SetMaxDASize RPC method unavailable"
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
We have seen 
```
"SetMaxDASize RPC method unavailable on endpoint, shutting down. Either enable it or disable throttling."
```
occur several times on our deployments, despite there being no misconfiguration of the EL endpoints.

We should try and make the logic governing this behavior more robust to temporary timeouts:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/27f6f505cdb65021d0446b51f21cdfe8b2a827b1/op-batcher/batcher/driver.go#L627-L638

We should also get the batcher to report this condition through a metric or log (instead of shutting down), and then we can define an alert and tune the definition so that there is some time for the problem to self-heal. This is because, it is actually safer to keep the batcher running even if an endpoint cannot be throttled (to prevent a DA backlog forming); although the failure to throttle should still be investigated with reasonably high urgency.

topPRs.title: feat: add SuperFaultDisputeGameV2
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Implements SuperFaultDisputeGameV2 following the V2 architecture pattern established in PR #16929.

## Key Changes

### New Files
- **`src/dispute/v2/SuperFaultDisputeGameV2.sol`**: V2 implementation with CWIA helper functions
- **`interfaces/dispute/v2/ISuperFaultDisputeGameV2.sol`**: Interface for SuperFaultDisputeGameV2

### Modified Files
- **`src/libraries/DevFeatures.sol`**: Added `DEPLOY_V2_SUPER_DISPUTE_GAMES` feature flag
- **`test/dispute/SuperFaultDisputeGame.t.sol`**: Added `SuperFaultDisputeGameV2_Constructor_Test` with constructor validation and CWIA tests
- **`test/dispute/DisputeGameFactory.t.sol`**: Added `setupSuperFaultDisputeGameV2()` factory helpers

### Implementation Details

The V2 implementation follows the same CWIA (Clones With Immutable Arguments) pattern as FaultDisputeGameV2:
- Added `expectedInitCallDataLength()` helper returning `6 + immutableArgsByteCount()`
- Added `immutableArgsByteCount()` helper returning `244` (total CWIA bytes)
- Updated version from `0.6.0` to `0.7.0`
- All CWIA offsets remain unchanged (SuperFaultDisputeGame was already V2-compatible)
- Preserves all Super-specific features:
  - `l2SequenceNumber()` instead of `l2BlockNumber()`
  - `startingProposal()` instead of `startingOutputRoot()`
  - No `challengeRootL2Block()` function
  - Validates `l2ChainId` is zero in `initialize()`

### Testing

Added comprehensive tests following the FaultDisputeGameV2 pattern:
- Constructor parameter validation (max depth, split depth, clock extension)
- CWIA validation tests (extra/missing immutable args bytes)
- All tests feature-gated with `DEPLOY_V2_SUPER_DISPUTE_GAMES` flag

### Pre-PR Checks

All checks passing:
- ✓ Build successful
- ✓ All tests compile
- ✓ Interface validation
- ✓ Semver checks
- ✓ Code quality checks

## Test Plan

```bash
# Run V2 tests with feature flag enabled
DEV_FEATURE__DEPLOY_V2_SUPER_DISPUTE_GAMES=true forge test --match-contract SuperFaultDisputeGameV2
```

## Related

- Follows pattern from PR #16929 (FaultDisputeGame → FaultDisputeGameV2)
- Part of the broader V2 dispute game architecture
